title: 2014 Was A Good Year For The Old 97's
teaser: The members of the Old 97's are showing no signs of their age, in a well-received album and stage show.
contentencoded:
It’s been a good year for the Old 97’s.

The band toured the country playing shows that received rave reviews, just as the group’s latest CD — “Most Messed Up” — did.

Ben Greenman — a reviewer for The New Yorker — called it “blistered, blasted and brilliant.”

We revisit Robin Young’s April conversation with the band’s leader Rhett Miller, when the CD was released.

Guest

  • Rhett Miller, front man for the Old 97’s. He tweets @rhettmiller.

Related

  • Old 97’s Have A Blast On New Album
